vertigo.context: The patient's main complaint is vertigo.

recurrent attacks of vertigo and imbalan.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of vertigo and imbalance over the last few years with periods of free symptoms and no concurrent tinnitus or hearing impairment.

tinnitus.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of vertigo and imbalance over the last few years with periods of free symptoms and no concurrent tinnitus or hearing impairment.

hearing impairment.context: The patient is having recurrent attacks of vertigo and imbalance over the last few years with periods of free symptoms and no concurrent tinnitus or hearing impairment.

normal MRI examination.context: She had previous normal MRI examination

bilateral intact tympanic membranes.context: Otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central Weber test and bilateral positive Rinne.

central Weber test.context: Otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central Weber test and bilateral positive Rinne.

positive Rinne.context: Otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central Weber test and bilateral positive Rinne.

no spontaneous, end gaze nystagmus.context: Frenzel Glasses Examination: no spontaneous, end gaze nystagmus.

no positional nystagmus.context: Dix-Hallpike: showed no positional nystagmus excluding benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.

benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.context: Dix-Hallpike: showed no positional nystagmus excluding benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.

corrective saccades.context: Vestibulocular Reflex [Halmagyi Test]: showed corrective saccades giving the impression of decompensated vestibular hypofunction.

decompensated vestibular hypofunction.context: Vestibulocular Reflex [Halmagyi Test]: showed corrective saccades giving the impression of decompensated vestibular hypofunction.

vestibular rehabilitation exercises.context: The patient was advised to continue her vestibular rehabilitation exercises and the additional medical treatment of betahistine at 24 mg dose bid.

betahistine.context: The patient was advised to continue her vestibular rehabilitation exercises and the additional medical treatment of betahistine at 24 mg dose bid.

electronystagmography.context: Plan: Planned for electronystagmography to document the degree of vestibular hypofunction.
